item.description:
I am posting this event for a friend and a member of our group - PedXing (Dave).  You can use this event listing to coordinate with other randomtites.

If you have never met him you are missing out - he's one of the best you could ever meet.  If you have, you know what I mean.

I have made a donation to Team PedXing on behalf of the Random Group of Hikers.

=====

This is a small charity walk which covers a 3 mile loop around a section of the Charles River. It's been a fun and festive fall occasion. There is coffee and breakfast pastry before the walk, and a luncheon reception after the walk.

The walk benefits The Phoenix Society for Burn Survivors and local burn survivors.

You do not have to register to drop by, but Dave is happy to cover the 15 dollar registration (which covers lunch and a T-shirt) fee for anyone who wants to come by.  Just send him an email with your T-Shirt size and name and he will register you.

In the first 5 years of this event, we have had food donated by Redbones as well as food grilled on site (burgers, dogs, veggie dogs) and we are hoping to have Redbones' food this year as well.

The Legion has an inexpensive cash bar (domestic beers are $2.25) on site.

Please email Dave for more information or make comments/ask questions with your RSVP.

10:00 Registration opens at:

American Legion Marsh Post
5 Greenough Boulevard, Cambridge, MA 

Pick Up Your Official T-Shirt

10:30 Team Photos

11:00 Opening Ceremonies

11:30 Walk Begins

Lunch reception to follow back at the American Legion Marsh Post

=====

Dave founded this walk 5 years ago as a way to give back to a community that had helped him in a time of need.  In 2004 he suffered severe burn injuries and was given a 50% chance of survival at best.  After 3 months in hospitals he was discharged home, disabled and with an uncertain future.

The fellowship and support he received from other burn survivors, including ones with injuries far more severe than his own - people who had lost hands, feet, vision, hearing or were significantly disfigured who took time to offer him their help made a difference in his recovery.

He also had the opportunity to see how the work changed the lives of people who had suffered traumatic injuries.   He was hugely fortunate in his recovery, the effects of his injuries usually go unnoticed and he is in better shape than he was before the accident.

This gives him the opportunity to both pay back and pass along the support he was given.  The Phoenix Society is a mostly volunteer organization with a very lean and efficient staff.

=====

For more information about the Phoenix Society please check out:

http://www.phoenix-society.org/

To join Team PedXing through Facebook (aka "The Causes Page"):

http://www.causes.com/causes/302329-team-pedxing-s-walk-for-burn-survivors?recruiter_id=14996510

For more about Dave's fascinating and moving story:

http://www.trailjournals.com/pedxinglt

http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2004/12/09/earlyshow/contributors/tracysmith/main660125.shtml
item.how_to_find_us: Please come to the Registration Table (ask for David)
item.name: Team PedXing Walks for Burn Survivors
